content:
I saw this statement while poking around in mathlib

theorem cantor_injective {α : Type*} (f : (α → Prop) → α) : ¬ function.injective f | i

What does | mean here? Also is there a way to print notation in general? I don't think this is an "operator" (I'm not sure if lean has operators specifically or only notation), because the symbol i does not seem to be declared before this line.
Nevermind... Upon rereading this I can see it's just the syntax for invoking the equation compiler. It was just indented interestingly.
